## Public Member Functions

### getInstruction() {#a817cf84960fdc0b60daaf11b6598f185}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DecodeStatus ARMDisassembler::getInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Instr, uint64&#95;t &amp; Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Bytes, uint64&#95;t Address, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; CStream) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Returns the disassembly of a single instruction.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Instr">- An MCInst to populate with the contents of the instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">- A value to populate with the size of the instruction, or the number of bytes consumed while attempting to decode an invalid instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Address">- The address, in the memory space of region, of the first byte of the instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Bytes">- A reference to the actual bytes of the instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="CStream">- The stream to print comments and annotations on.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- MCDisassembler::Success if the instruction is valid, MCDisassembler::SoftFail if the instruction was disassemblable but invalid, MCDisassembler::Fail if the instruction was invalid.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/lib/target/arm/disassembler/armdisassembler-cpp/#l00145">145</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/lib/target/arm/disassembler/armdisassembler-cpp">ARMDisassembler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### suggestBytesToSkip() {#aff1d6eda516ee7a8ce4dd5334cc39586}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t ARMDisassembler::suggestBytesToSkip (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Bytes, uint64&#95;t Address) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Suggest a distance to skip in a buffer of data to find the next place to look for the start of an instruction.

For example, if all instructions have a fixed alignment, this might advance to the next multiple of that alignment.

If not overridden, the default is 1.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Address">- The address, in the memory space of region, of the starting point (typically the first byte of something that did not decode as a valid instruction at all).</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Bytes">- A reference to the actual bytes at Address. May be needed in order to determine the width of an unrecognized instruction (e.g. in Thumb this is a simple consistent criterion that doesn&#39;t require knowing the specific instruction). The caller can pass as much data as they have available, and the function is required to make a reasonable default choice if not enough data is available to make a better one.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- A number of bytes to skip. Must always be greater than zero. May be greater than the size of Bytes.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/lib/target/arm/disassembler/armdisassembler-cpp/#l00149">149</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/lib/target/arm/disassembler/armdisassembler-cpp">ARMDisassembler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
